summary.para: The exception that is thrown when the file image of a DLL or an executable program is invalid.

content.para: This exception is thrown when the file image of an executable program is invalid. For example, this exception is thrown when unmanaged code is passed to M:System.Reflection.Assembly.Load(System.String) for loading.
T:System.BadImageFormatException uses the HRESULT COR_E_BADIMAGEFORMAT, which has the value 0x8007000B.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of T:System.BadImageFormatException, see the T:System.BadImageFormatException constructors.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class.

content.para: This constructor initializes the P:System.Exception.Message property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Format of the executable or library is invalid." This message takes into account the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.BadImageFormatException.

entry.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class.
Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class.
Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class with serialized data.

content.para: The T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The T:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream. For more information, see [<topic://cpconSerialization>].

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class with a specified error message.

content.para: The message that describes the error.
The content of the message parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.BadImageFormatException.

entry.para: A null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

content.para: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the inner parameter is not a null reference, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the P:System.Exception.InnerException property. The P:System.Exception.InnerException property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or null if the P:System.Exception.InnerException property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.BadImageFormatException.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class with a specified error message and file name.

content.para: A message that describes the error.
The full name of the file with the invalid image.
The content of the message parameter is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.

entry.para: The full name of the file with the invalid image.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the T:System.BadImageFormatException class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

content.para: The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The full name of the file with the invalid image.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the inner parameter is not null, the current exception is raised in a catch block that handles the inner exception.

An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the P:System.Exception.InnerException property. The P:System.Exception.InnerException property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or null if the P:System.Exception.InnerException property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of T:System.BadImageFormatException.

entry.para: The full name of the file with the invalid image.

summary.para: Gets the name of the file that causes this exception.

returnValue.para: The name of the file with the invalid image, or a null reference if no file name was passed to the constructor for the current instance.

content.para: This property returns the name of the file supplied to the constructor for the current instance, if any. If the file name was not specified or is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), this property returns a null reference.
This property is read-only.

summary.para: Gets the log file that describes why an assembly load failed.

returnValue.para: A String containing errors reported by the assembly cache.

summary.para: Sets the T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo object with the file name, assembly cache log, and additional exception information.

content.para: The T:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo that holds the serialized object data about the exception being thrown.
The T:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext that contains contextual information about the source or destination.
The caller does not have the required permission.

to provide evidence and view and modify policy. Associated enumerations: F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.ControlEvidence, F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermissionFlag.ControlPolicy.

summary.para: Gets the error message and the name of the file that caused this exception.

returnValue.para: A string containing the error message and the name of the file that caused this exception.

content.para: If no message was supplied to the constructor for the current exception, this property returns a system-supplied error message. If the P:System.BadImageFormatException.FileName property is not a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), the message includes the file name.
This property is read-only.

summary.para: Returns the fully qualified name of this exception and possibly the error message, the name of the inner exception, and the stack trace.

returnValue.para: A string containing the fully qualified name of this exception and possibly the error message, the name of the inner exception, and the stack trace.

content.para: The string representation returned by this method includes the name of the exception, the value of the P:System.BadImageFormatException.Message property, the result of calling ToString on the inner exception, the value of the P:System.BadImageFormatException.FileName property, and the result of calling P:System.Environment.StackTrace. If any of these members is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), its value is not included in the returned string.
